definitions: To mix (ingredients) together in a confused mass.
To move quickly and with difficulty, typically on hands and knees.
To make (a radio or telephone signal) unintelligible by altering its frequency or amplitude.
To cook (eggs) by mixing the whites and yolks and stirring them while heating.
examples: He scrambled the eggs for breakfast.
The children scrambled over the rocks.
The signal was scrambled to prevent eavesdropping.
She scrambled to finish her homework before the deadline.
